message:
WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN, SOCIALIST, SECULAR, DEMOCRATIC, REPUBLIC..................this twenty-sixth day of November, 1949, do HEREBY ADOPT, ENACT AND GIVE TO OURSELVES THIS CONSTITUTION.

As the nation celebrates the Constitution Day on November 26, let us reiterate our pledge to uphold our constitution by promoting harmony & brotherhood and protecting the sovereignty, unity and integrity of India.

जय हिन्द, जय भारत

Mr. Dolores O' Riordan, Vice Precident, The Global Engagement yesterday visited the Food Processing Division of the Department of Agricultural & Food Engineering. He was accompanied by Prof. Colm O'Donnel, Principal, School of Biosystems & Food Engineering, UCD, Dublin, Ireland.
Prof. H N Mishra, Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering told Awaaz that they ratified an MoU with IIT Kharagpur on the establishment of a Food Technology and Entrepreneurship Park, Make in India initiatives on Nutrition, Food Security & Health and on Student Exchange Program. Prof. Mishra also added that while their visit to Food Chemistry & Technology Lab and the High Pressure Processing Unit, they have agreed to share and collaborate the state of the art techniques and equipment with the Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering.

In one of the country's most awaited developments in the field of science, today CERN Director General, Fabiola Gianotti, and Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission and Secretary of the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE) of the Government of India, Sekhar Basu signed an Agreement admitting India to CERN as an Associate Member. 

The Government of India still needs to notify CERN of its final approval for the agreement to enter into force.
Source - CERN

In order to increase the participation of IIT Kharagpur in various open-source programs like Google Summer of Code, Outreachy and much more, a new initiative by Kharagpur Open Source Society has been taken for the students of IIT Kharagpur to help them prepare for many prestigious open source programs.

Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) is a December-long online program where the students will get a unique experience of software development while being coached by mentors all around the open source world as well as many ex-GSoCers.

Go to http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in and register yourself. The program starts on 1st December. The program is open to all students regardless of their department, course, degree or the year. 

Also, if you want to be a mentor in the program, go to the website and host your project.

Our Professors Honoured!

Prof. Khanindra Pathak, Department of Mining Engineering, has been selected as Member, Experts Committee for Standardization of Environmental Clearance for Coal Mining & Coal Washery by the Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change, Government of India.

Prof. Rintu Banerjee, Department of Agricultural & Food Engineering, has been selected for the DPD Endowment Award by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare, Government of India.

Prof. Rajib Maity, Department of Civil Engineering, has been selected as James Rennell MoES Young Fellow by the Ministry of Earth Sciences, Government of India.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur proudly congratulates all of them

To keep pace with world standards,certain important initiatives of Railways for Research & Development have been launched. Technology Mission for Indian Railways has been set up and centres for Railway research (CRR) have been sanctioned at IIT Kharagpur, IIT Roorkee, Mumbai University, IIT Kanpur and IIT Chennai to carry out the research in various areas. This is seen as a small effort in the direction of keeping up with the world standards. Here is the link to the complete story:
http://www.business-standard.com/article/government-press-release/important-initiatives-of-railways-for-research-development-116111601442_1.html

Your father is a retired IPS. You did your Engineering from IIT Kharagpur, Masters from the prestigious Faculty of Management Studies, University of Delhi and then another MBA from the London Business School; and now you conspire forgeries defaming the institutions and your parents who have fostered you through years.
The Vijayanagar Police yesterday arrested two techies in an 85 lakhs duping case. The mastermind Abhishek Dhoreliya (An IIT Kharagpur Graduate) is still at large. Earlier, Abhishek had also been convicted in a 1.03 crore scam under the Foreign (Contribution) Regulation Act (FCRA) 2010 for fraud international transactions, a case which is still pending at the Hon'ble High Court of Delhi.

Let us remember that in "What we have become" lies "what we are made" through the sacrifices of our family, our society and of our country and her people. Money matters, but it can never be above the ethics and the integrity.
कर्मभूमि है निखिल महीतल, जब तक अपनी काया। 
तब तक है जीवन के, अणु-अणु में कर्त्तव्य समाया।।
                                         - राष्ट्रकवि डॉ श्री रामधारी सिंह 'दिनकर'

Source(s): The New Indian Express, Bengaluru City & The Hindu, Mysore Edition.

The Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) have sought Rs. 22,000 crore from the Ministry of Human Resource Development that is needed to spend over the next five years to improve their infrastructure and rise in global rankings. QS World University Rankings for 2016-17 had seen six of the IITs slump down from their positions. The money has been sought as part of Project Vishwajeet, which HRD Ministry wants to implement in order to make the IITs reach within the ranks of the top 100 universities in the world by 2018 and within the top 50 by 2020. 
The IITs targeted are Delhi, Bombay, Kanpur, Kharagpur, Madras, Roorkee and Guwahati. Of the nearly Rs 22,000 crore, IIT-Kharagpur has sought Rs 3,700 crore, IIT-Bombay Rs 2,250 crore, IIT-Delhi Rs 2,400 crore, IIT-Kanpur Rs 2,475 crore, IIT-Madras Rs 2,800 crore, IIT-Guwahati Rs 2,695 crore and IIT-Roorkee Rs 5,550 crore. The money will go into improving "research output, faculty, infrastructure and international outlook."

The word career means a person's "course or progress through life". It has proven itself to be more complex and overloaded than string theory and sure has taken away the sleep of many young people.

Carrying forward the series 'aap ki raay', the results of the third poll showcase the factors prioritized by students while choosing a career. Evidently, a lion's share of the students aren't sure about their career goals and are still exploring the possible options. A little more than one-sixth felt that running after money is the need of the hour and is fairly justified to do so.

About 18% are following their interests, ignoring factors such as job security and others whereas about 7% are blindly following the herd. Just the 1% are working on their own startup ideas and have opted out of campus placements. Another 8% have planned for higher studies including options like an MS or a PhD degree, IAS, etc. and have as well opted out of campus placements. More than 17% have an interest in two of the latter options but would still like to keep placements from the campus as a backup.

GC 2016-17 || Inter Hall Sketching ||
The event saw participants illustrating their sketching skills. Many amazing talents were depicted which turned it out to be a close competition.

The individual standings are as follows : 
GOLD : Shared between Swastik Pradhan(HJB) and Idris Islahi M (LBS) - 160 points
SILVER : Soham Ghosh (Nehru) - 148 points
BRONZE : Samya Samanta (LLR) - 147points

Hall standings sum up as follows :
GOLD : Nehru - 425 points
SILVER : LLR - 412 points
BRONZE : Azad - 404 points

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

Human rights are rights inherent to all human beings, whatever our nationality, place of residence, sex, national or ethnic origin, color, religion, language, or any other status. We are all equally entitled to our human rights without discrimination. These rights are all interrelated, interdependent and indivisible.
In our new section, we are going to introduce the various rights that we often hear about but don’t know about it in depth. Being the Voice of Kgp , Awaaz IIT Kharagpur takes this initiative as a responsibility to make you all aware about your ‘Human Rights’. We will start this section with the Right to Information, popularly known as the RTI.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_hr

It's a pleasure to announce that the students of Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law are organising the 3rd National Moot Court Competition which is to be held at the RGSOIPL department from 11th to13th of November'16.
This Third edition of NMCC has seen considerable expansion from the last, with over twenty teams from all over the country. Eminent lawyers, judges and legal professional have been invited to judge the various teams. This competition will feature the best of legal thinking and logical reasoning.  
So, you all are invited to join this program and have first hand experience of the trials of the courtroom and the intricacies of law.

On the occasion of 141st Patel Jayanti, Patel Hall launched a "Unity  Drive" which comprised of Cloth Donation(held on 3rd Nov) and Blood Donation event( held on 5th Nov) .
While the cloth donation event manifested joy among the villagers, the blood donation event resulted in a collection of 134 units of blood.

The Hall President of Patel Hall, Mr Chandra Mohan Meena  said " We are the young generation and we have to think about the social issues which our country is facing and have to find ways to work on it. "If we won't then who will?"

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates  Patel hall for successful completion of the event and also urges other halls to take such social initiative.

|| Important Notice ||
As per the orders from the Prime Minister of India, from midnight of November 8, 2016, Rs. 500 and Rs.1000 will cease to be legal tender i.e. these notes will just be papers from tomorrow.
The ATMs will not function till November 9, and in some places till November 10 too. 
 
Here’s what you need to know:  
# All banks will remain closed for public work on November 9.
# Deposit currently used notes of Rs 500 and Rs 1000 in post office accounts or banks by December 30, 2016. There will be no limit on the deposit amounts.
# Exchange old notes of Rs 500 and Rs 1000 at any bank, head post office or sub-post office by showing ID proof. The limit for this is Rs 4000 upto Nov 24.
# There’ll be a limit on withdrawal of Rs 10,000 per day and Rs 20,000 per week. This limit will be increased in the coming days.
# No restrictions of any kind on non-cash payments by cheques, demand drafts, debit or credit cards and electronic fund transfers.
# Rs 500 and Rs 1000 will cease to be legal tender from the midnight of November 8, 2016.
# ATM withdrawals will be restricted to Rs 2,000 per day till November 11, after which this limit may be increased slowly.
# For 72 hours, these places and institutions will continue to accept Rs 500 and Rs 1000 notes for payment:
--Government hospitals will continue to accept old Rs 500, Rs 1000 notes for payment.
--Railway ticket booking counters, ticket counters of government buses and airline ticket counters at airports will accept old notes for purchase of tickets.
--Petrol, diesel and gas stations authorised by public sector oil companies
--Consumer co-operative stores authorised by state or central government.
--Milk booths authorised by state governments
--Crematoria and burial grounds

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur advises the Kgp public to be on a safe side in the next two days and exchange/deposit such notes as soon as possible.
For further details see: http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/live-narendra-modis-address-to-nation/article9320548.ece

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा? 

कहते हैं विचारों को आप मार नहीं सकते; सही ही है| साथ ही जब तक मीडिया और पत्रकारिता का अस्तित्व बचा रहेगा तब तक ये विचार द्रुत गति से फैलते रहेंगे | आज हम ऐसे समय में जी रहे हैं जब वैचारिक असहिष्णुता आम हो गयी है और ऐसे में ज़रूरत होती है एक जागरूक, बेचैन और साहसी तबके की जो हर किस्म की नाइंसाफियों पर बेबाकी से बोले और समाज के हित में पहलुओं का विश्लेषण करे |

आज से दस वर्ष पूर्व खड़गपुर में जब ऐसे तबके की ज़रूरत महसूस हुई तब स्थापना की गयी उत्साह से लबरेज एक टीम की - 'आवाज़', जिसका उद्देश्य था कि वह कैंपस के जन जन की आवाज़ बन जाए | पत्रकारिता में विचारों की जंग होती ही रहती है; पत्रकार का काम ही है कि वो हर पहलू को दिखाए, और इन दस सालों में न जाने हमने कितने महत्त्वपूर्ण पड़ावों को पार किया, न जाने कितनी मुश्किलें झेलीं और आलोचनाएं तो समय समय पर लगी ही रहती हैं | 

खैर, आलोचनाएं इस बात का प्रतीक हैं कि हमें ग़म्भीरता से लिया तो जा रहा है, और इनसे प्रेरित होकर हम लगे रहे, और इतिहास इस बात का साक्षी रहा है कि हमने सूरत को बदलने की कोई कसर न छोड़ी | साल दर साल बीतते गए, पर अपने KGP जनता के हित में हमने हरसम्भव मदद करने की कोशिश की | GC से लेकर प्लेसमेंट्स तक- हर खबर का हर पहलू आप तक पहुँचाया गया | 

हम वैसे समय में हैं जहाँ पत्रकारिता में हाथ घुमाकर अपनी ही पीठ थपथपाने का प्रचलन बढ़ गया है क्योंकि जनमानस का उत्साहवर्धन क्षीण पड़ता जा रहा है, और हमें गर्व है हमारी टीम पर, टीम के भूतपूर्व सदस्यों पर, टीम को सतत मार्गदर्शन देने वाले शिक्षकों पर और सबसे बढ़कर आप पर, क्योंकि आप ही से तो हमारा वजूद है | हम सभी एक बार पुनः आप सभी जनों का आभार प्रकट करते हैं और आशा करते हैं कि आगे भी यह सहयोग बना रहेगा |

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा? 

कहते हैं विचारों को आप मार नहीं सकते; सही ही है| साथ ही जब तक मीडिया और पत्रकारिता का अस्तित्व बचा रहेगा तब तक ये विचार द्रुत गति से फैलते रहेंगे | आज हम ऐसे समय में जी रहे हैं जब वैचारिक असहिष्णुता आम हो गयी है और ऐसे में ज़रूरत होती है एक जागरूक, बेचैन और साहसी तबके की जो हर किस्म की नाइंसाफियों पर बेबाकी से बोले और समाज के हित में पहलुओं का विश्लेषण करे |

Patel Hall recently organised a Unity Drive on the occasion of Patel Jayanti. The drive was aimed at contributing to the needy and consisted of cloth donation and blood donation events.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates Patel Hall for their efforts in unifying the entire KGP to come together for social cause.
We went to the location and had an interview with the students over there. Let's see what they had to say.

Participate in the poll in huge numbers so that we can have a fair analysis. You can opt for multiple options.

#Aap_Ki_Raay_3...more to come.

Continuing the series “आप की राय”,the results of the second poll stress on the communication gap between general student community and office bearers of gymkhana.It can be seen that majority of students demand a platform to raise their problems whereas more than one-fifth felt that officials act carelessly.
Around 31% believed that it should be the responsibility of media houses to organize open house sessions with office bearers where student community could raise their interests.On the other hand,only 10% felt that office bearers are easily approachable and they behave positively.A meager 6.3% say that officials reply to their emails, calls, and messages in case of serious issues.
It is evident from the results that student community is not satisfied with the existing system and the need of the hour is to take up this issue seriously and come up with some feasible solutions.

In the backdrop of slashing of the Government funding to the institute and increase in fees for the students, IIT Kharagpur has come up with a plan called ‘Learn, Earn and Return’ to ensure a financial support system for the needy students and imbibe the culture of giving back among the KGPians to sustain regular inflow of funds. The scheme precisely tends to create a cycle of flow of funds to the institute in which the alumni will fund the study of current students who in turn will return the money manifold to the institute. Read the full article to know more about this initiative at the given link.

Carbon dioxide which may be a dangerous waste for the planet is a vital input for Tuticorin Alkali Chemicals for making soda ash. They are unable to get enough carbon dioxide which has been resolved by a six-year-old startup, Carbon Clean Solutions which was set up by two undergraduate students in 2009. The startup meant at  extracting carbon dioxide from flue gases in power plants and use it to make valuable products and even the CEO of Carbon Cleans Solutions said: “We are innovating the carbon dioxide capture so that its price is no more a constraint for conversion to products.” There are about 22 plants which have the capacity to capture around 40million tonnes per year, according to Global CSS Institute, an International member driven organisation. Aniruddha Sharma and Prateek Bumb started this startup and because of their hard work, they are able to develop proprietary solvent which could dissolve carbon dioxide and after testing, it came out that it could remove 90% carbon dioxide from fuel gases. Finally, they got Tuticorin Alkali Chemicals as their customer which is a big breakthrough for the company.

IITs are looking forward to better placements this December as compared to last year in the same month. There has been an increase of about 25%-30% in the pre-placement offers (PPOs) and the companies are eager to sign up to recruit the students. The companies that had already hired students as interns have taken the PPO route this year and are ready to recruit them full time. 
Across IITs, IIT-Kharagpur has received 150 PPOs and is inching closer to its last year's mark of 170. The institute is expecting 250 companies to arrive on campus for recruitment, which begins from December 1st. Around 1,950 students are gearing up for the placement process.
Source:- Business Insider

Patel Hall of Residence is organizing a Blood Donation Camp as part of its Unity Drive which was launched earlier in this week to honor Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on his 141st Birth Anniversary. The Hall dedicates this Blood Donation Camp to their beloved senior Sagar Khurana who is no longer with us. A Cloth Donation event is already in motion as part of the drive. All interested are welcome to donate for this cause. The schedule is as follows :

Date: 5th Nov’16 (Saturday)
Time: 11.30 AM Onwards
Venue: Patel Hall Common Room

Please take note of the following-
1. Girls/Women can also participate in this camp.
2. Donors are requested to have an early breakfast at least 2 hours before the donation as it is a strict medical requirement.
3. Refreshments will be provided after the donation.

Recently, a new enterprise called PaperCut Notebooks has been started by IITKGP students to tackle the problems of increasing price of stationary items, especially notebooks, year after year. They are providing high-quality notebook at relatively lower cost than what is available in the market. It has been launched this week and to mark the occasion they have distributed notebooks to every student of "Jagriti Vidya Mandir", a school run by Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS), on 28th October, free of cost.  Let’s wish them all the best for their future.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Sourabh Meena and Prashant Pundeer.

World Happiness Report published by the United Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network ranks India 118th position among 156 countries in the measure of happiness. The Report reveals a significant decrease in the level of happiness of South Asian countries. Unhappiness and stress might lead to depression and anxiety, and the cases of the same could be found in the very own campus of IIT Kharagpur. World Happiness Report, 2013 demonstrates that a large amount of cases of depression and anxiety disorders occur between the age groups of 15 and 24 years. Hence, being an institute of national importance, IIT Kharagpur can play a major role in improving the current scenario and to promote science and practice of positivity for fostering meaningful life. In a belief of exploring the science behind happiness, IIT Kharagpur Alumnus, Mr. Satinder Singh Rekhi along with Director, IIT Kharagpur, Prof Partha Pratim Chakraborty brought the idea of a new course on ‘The Science of Happiness’ and planned to involve the course in academic curricula of IIT Kharagpur. So, here is the full article on "Science of Happiness" to let the world know more about the science behind happiness and the new initiative of IIT Kharagpur.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_soh

Computer Science and Engineering department of our institute in collaboration with Research, Designs and Standards Organisation (RDSO) and Service Improvement Group (SIG) of the Indian Railways has developed a tool suite for electronic railway interlocking system which prevents trains from colliding into each other. Researchers said that this project can be extended for further study to develop traffic operation plans. The Indian Railways, through RDSO, has awarded 12 research projects to IIT Kharagpur’s Centre for Railway Research and several of these project and technologies are being field tested after lab testing at IIT Kharagpur.

message:
Illumination: The Light in Kgp's Night
As the entire nation is gearing up for one of the most awaited festive moments of the year ‘Diwali’, the students at IIT KGP are pouring their heart out for the preparation of their own unique way of celebrating Diwali, the tradition which they call ‘Illumination’ or just ‘Illu’. For KGP, Illu is Diwali and Diwali is Illu. For the freshers who will be going to witness this trademark celebration of Diwali for the first time, they must be feeling intrigued when they find the air buzzing with ‘illu’. They must be having such questions in their mind like what is it?, what’s so special about it?, what for our seniors are working so hard?, is that effort worth it? And all”. As the campus media body of IIT KGP, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur feels that the tale of this unique tradition must be passed on to the newcomers. So, here is this article on Illumination to let the world know about this masterpiece of KGP students where technology meets tradition.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_illu

The name of this young genius is Madhav Datt. He joined the environmental club in his school in standard 3. Some may find it hard to digest but yes, it was at this very early age where he became aware of the "actions" that are being taken to protect the environment. Celebrate DIWALI, Celebrate LIFE !

Diwali is an occasion to celebrate victory over defeat, light over darkness, awareness over ignorance; in one word, it is an occasion to celebrate optimism. Saamanjasya, the social club of VGSoM, IIT
Kharagpur celebrates this occasion of life every year in a very special manner, by spreading the smile on the faces of the very special children at Deesha Seema, a value education center at IIT Kharagpur for orphans. Saamanjasya takes a noble move towards filling the life of those little angels with happiness and light. They raise the funds for Diwali Celebration at Deesha Seema through T-shirt sales drive. This year, they received a really positive response to this Sales-drive from all the students of IIT, in this way you all have contributed ‘A Smile’ to an innocent face. 

Diwali is knocking the door and Saamanjasya welcomes you all to join the Diwali Celebrations at Deesha Seema and spend the evening with the very special kids. Here are some of the pics from the event.

|| INTER HALL DEBATE RESULTS ||

As the battle for General Championship is getting intense day by day, Inter Hall debate competition was organised today in F-127. There is no need to mention that the participants left no stone unturned in giving their best as we all are familiar with the kind of zeal and enthusiasm with which students fight for the glory of their respective halls. After a very fierce competition, the individual winners were:

GOLD: Kunal Jain (LLR)
SILVER: Vishal Chauhan (RP) and Aditya Kothari (LBS)
BRONZE: Rohit Sar (Azad)

Hall standings were as follow:
1. LLR - 74.5 points
2. Azad - 72 points
3. RP - 69.5 points
4. LBS - 68 points

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

Researchers from our institute have achieved another milestone in their field. They have designed a software that enables those with neuro-motor disorders to access the web, play games, and participate in social networking with ease.  This disease occurs when specialist nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord called motor neurons stop working properly and eventually lead to muscle weakness, often with visible wasting. 
"For the neuro-motor disorders, we have developed the interface by which they can access web and carry out social networking activities," says Professor Anupam Basu, from the department of computer science , lead researcher and Head and Chairman, Centre for Education Technology, IIT Kharagpur.

Extending its brilliant heritage in biotechnical research, IIT Kharagpur,jointly with IIEST Shibpur and Guru Nanak Institute of Dental Sciences and Research (GNIDSR), has initiated a joint interdisciplinary research in fields of oral health care by signing a MoU on the same. This initiative aims to gather information and tackle oral cancer and pre-cancer problems the people in India face.
Already into lines of conducting stem cell research,which would range cures for many ailments, the Institute has therefore extended its arms wide for future biotechnical research in India and the world at large.
Such an initiative wouldn't only benefit the general public,but would also open doors to advanced stem cell and other research avenues in the near future.

In the era of entrepreneurship, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its duty to share some of the successful startup stories related to IIT Kharagpur. Here, 8th in the series we present to you the story of Sachin Jaiswal, CEO of Niki.ai. He is a 2011 batch pass out from the department of Electrical engineering, IIT Kharagpur and boarder of Radha Krishnan Hall of Residence. Niki.ai was founded in April 2015 by four IIT Kharagpur alumni – Sachin Jaiswal, Keshav Prawasi, Nitin Babel and Shishir Modi. Niki.ai is a chatbot that users can ‘talk’ to. The app understands human language in the context of the products or services, which users wish to avail. So let's see what Sachin has to say about Niki.ai and his journey to CEO: http://bit.ly/AwaazKYE8
#KYE8

The Weightlifting Team of IIT Kgp has emerged as overall champion after Day 2 of “SPARDHA 16”, the All India Games And Sports festival of IIT BHU. 
Results of Day2 Weightlifting events are:
56 Kg category: Biddu Bhushan Singh (Silver)
62 Kg category: Udit Narayan (Silver) 
69 Kg category: Manny Jain (Bronze)
77 Kg category: Sawai Devpal (Bronze)
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the weightlifting team. You have made us proud.
#GO_KGP

The Weightlifting Team of IIT Kgp has emerged as overall champion after Day 2 of “SPARDHA 16”, the All India Games And Sports festival of IIT BHU. 
Results of Day2 Weightlifting events are:
56 Kg category: Biddu Bhushan Singh (Silver)
62 Kg category: Udit Narayan (Silver) 
69 Kg category: Manny Jain (Bronze)
77 Kg category: Sawai Devpal (Bronze)
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the weightlifting team. You have made us proud.
#GO_KGP 
#WE_KAN

message:
The revamped and refurbished Kabaddi World Cup had a grand finale in Ahmedabad on Saturday night, after a thrilling final that saw hosts India produce top class kabaddi to overcome Iran 38-29. However, some things never change, and India's kabaddi supremacy is certainly one of these. Indian Side considered overwhelming favorites to lift their third World Cup, did so in emphatic fashion. However, doing so against an Iran side that played the match of their lifetimes has an astonishing feel about it.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur hereby celebrate this victory of our country in Kabaddi World Cup 2016.

A candle light march was organised this evening in memory of Sagar Khurana (CSE/2013/Patel) by Patel Hall students. It started from Patel Hall via Gymkhana to Bidhan Chowk in the main building today at 6 PM. Sagar Khurana was diagnosed with cancer and pneumonia which led to his sad demise in Gurgaon. He was one of the brightest students of the 2013 batch who never refrained himself in helping out the people. He was a selfless human being and was a source of inspiration and motivation to many. The march was attended by hundreds of students. At the end of candle march a silence of one minute was observed to pay tribute to him.

message:
For a student, internship or training matter a lot in the shaping of their career. He/She gets the opportunity to learn many things during their internships. Getting an internship opportunity in a foreign institution is the new craze among students. Almost everyone is putting his efforts to bag an FT. But many students aren't aware of the fundamentals of this and don't know what to do and how to do. To help such students, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you this article which will hopefully cater to your needs.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/ft.php?page=home

राजभाषा विभाग, भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर द्वारा हिन्दी दिवस 2016 के उपलक्ष्य में प्राध्यापकों, अधिकारियों, स्टाफ और छात्रों के लिए प्रतियोगिताओं एवं कार्यक्रमों का आयोजन किया जा रहा है | ये प्रतियोगिताएं 24 से 28 अक्टूबर के बीच आयोजित होंगी | प्रतियोगिताओं में वाद-विवाद, निबंध, आशुभाषण, काव्यपाठ आदि भी शामिल हैं | आप सभी से हार्दिक अनुरोध है कि उत्साह के साथ इस कार्यक्रम में अपनी सहभागिता सुनुश्चित कराएं और इस आयोजन को सफल बनाने में अपना योगदान दें | 
अन्य जानकारी हेतु 81718, 81864 पर राजभाषा विभाग अथवा 9308591858, 9641049944 एवं 9564156315 पर संपर्क कर सकते हैं। कार्यक्रम की विस्तृत जानकारी नीचे संलग्न पोस्टर में दी गयी है |

Events to be held on Day 2 are:-
Weightlifting for 56,62,69,77 kg category.
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur wishes BEST OF LUCK to team Kgp.

With the utmost pain and sadness, we are informing you that Sagar Khurana (CSE/2013/Patel) is no more between us. He was diagnosed with cancer and pneumonia which led to his sad demise yesterday in Gurgaon. Sagar was a great human being of selfless nature who was always very humble in every situation that he faced. He represented Patel Hall and IIT Kharagpur in Cricket and was one of the best fast bowlers KGP has ever produced. He held a number of posts in his hall during his stay at IIT Kharagpur and was a well known Maths wiz and a tech geek in the campus. He was one of brightest students of the 2013 CSE batch who never refrained himself in helping out people. He was a guiding light, a star to whoever knew him and the reason why so many people are crying today is because above all things, he was the sweetest soul you'll come across. A heart so generous, a soul so pure and an attitude that's par excellence. We weep today because we have lost someone who was in all of us. KGP will always remember him as its sincerest and brightest student. May his soul rest in peace.

To express its deep condolences, Patel Hall is organizing a candle march today at 6 PM from PATEL HALL via Gymkhana TO BIDHAN CHOWK  in the main building. We request the entire student fraternity and faculty to attend this candle march.

Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur congratulates Team SEAL: Manaar Alam, Vidya Govindan , Sarani Bhattacharya, Debapriya Basu Roy(mentors: Rajat Subhra Chakraborty, Debdeep Mukhopadhyay) to qualify for the finals of the Ninth Embedded Security Challenge, hosted by NYU Tandon School of Engineering. 
For the first time, IIT students from India are among seven teams to have sailed through to the finals of the oldest and largest hardware hacking competition in the world. They are among the only two Indian teams who qualified for the same, the other team being from IIT Madras.
For further details : http://www.businessinsider.in/Meet-the-IITians-who-have-made-their-way-into-worlds-largest-hardware-hacking-competition-finals/articleshow/54831499.cms

In a recent meeting of IIT directors and experts on project "VISHWAJEET" that seeks to make IITs world class institute decided to modernize five laboratories each in seven old IITs. They will be made at par with the best in the world. These labs will get funding from proposed Higher Education Finance Agency, directly from government and industry. 
Project "VISHWAJEET" will aim to pick the IITs with the greatest potential to climb up the global pecking order and then ensure close focus on them, backed with funding, so that they excel on all parameters.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is launching a new Web series ‘आप की राय’ in which we will create a poll on a weekly basis which would cover  general, administrative and national issues. Our report on that would be a reflection of the views of the student community of IIT Kharagpur.
The first poll in the basket is on " ILLUMINATION ", which defines Diwali for the students of IIT Kharagpur. Go to the below link, participate in the poll in huge numbers so that we can have a fair analysis on the issues.

Are the rising numbers of mosquitoes in our campus bothering you? Well, we should be happy that institute is all prepared to help you in case you catch malaria. Researchers at Bio-medical Imaging Informatics (BMI) Lab, led by Chandan Chakraborty and his research team at the School of Medical Science & Technology, IIT Kharagpur  has developed a smartphone app that will be beneficial in the detection of malaria. The present detection and treatment methods are very time-consuming. The development of such an app and technology can help in easy and early detection of malaria. The app has been tested on more than 200 microscopic images of 80 patients and it detected the disease with more than 90%  accuracy.

Indian Institute of Science Bangalore has named second of the prestigious three Distinguished Chairs in Neurocomputing and Data Science (NCDS) after Mrs. Sudha Murty, an alumnus of IISc. Prof. Vasant Honavar, the Edward Frymoyer Endowed Professor of Information Sciences and Technology at Pennsylvania State University, is the first recipient of the Chair. The objective of this initiative is to promote high-impact collaboration leading to capacity building and ecosystem creation in the brain, computation, data, and systems.

Mrs. Sudha Murty, Chairperson, Infosys Foundation is currently serving as a member of Board of Governors, IIT Kharagpur.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is glad to congratulate Mrs. S. Murty.

Up to 10% additional seats in each Indian Institute of Technology course can now go to foreign students. The 10% intake is in addition to the existing seats available in each of the 23 IITs. Foreign students will have to take the JEE Advanced examination only and not the JEE Mains exams to qualify for a seat in IIT. For MTech courses, they will have to qualify Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE). The exams will be held in six international centers instead of just one so far. These countries are Ethiopia, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, UAE, Nepal, and Singapore. 

It has been clarified by the officials that an increased number of seats for foreign students does not mean lesser seats for Indian students.

Citing limitations of resources from infrastructure to faculty the seven older IITs namely Kharagpur,Bombay, Delhi,Kanpur,Roorkee,Madras and Guwahati have refused to increase their B.Tech seats as proposed by the government at IIT Council meeting held on 23rd August. However , the second generation IITs namely Hyderabad, Mandi, Ropar, Patna, Jammu will increase their UG seats by 40,50,25,105,30 respectively from next year onwards. The IIT Council had earlier approved increasing the student strength from 72000 to 1 Lakh by 2020.

IIT KGP students have again shown their technical prowess and have made the entire KGP community feel proud of them. This time, institute’s Aerial Robotics Kharagpur (ARK) has carved out its niche in the national arena and they have been the talk of the town for last few days. They are developing drones using indigenous hardware and software which will be capable of autonomous flight, localisation in GPS-denied environments, and tracking and interacting with mobile ground robots as well as other drones, and much more. This technology can prove to be a major breakthrough in various fields like agriculture technology, mine surveying, surveillance etc. Recently, ARK were the only team from India to participate in International Aerial Robotics Competition at Beijing (China) in September.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur applauds the efforts of the entire team of ARK and wishes them for their future endeavours.

Source: Business Standard

Mr. Subrata Paul (1974/ME/RP) has been appointed Director, Globsyn Business School, Kolkata. After graduating from IIT Kharagpur, he went on to study further at the London Business School.
Interestingly, the post of the Executive Chairman of Globsyn Group is also held by an IIT KGP alumnus, Mr. Bikram Dasgupta (1973/MA/RP).

Source: The Hindu Business Line, Kolkata Metro City Edition

We extend our warm congratulations to Mr. Paul

You may be aware of the recent communal riot in Golbazar and adjoining areas. A curfew has been imposed in those areas and police are not allowing entry of transport vehicles into godowns. As a result, supply of essential items like vegetables, milk, curd, bread, etc. is affected for the past few days.

If the situation does not improve by tomorrow then mess services would be severely affected. It may not be possible to serve vegetables, milk, bread, etc.

All the students are requested to cooperate and bear with the inconvenience for a few days. The HMC is closely monitoring the situation and would take emergency measures if necessary.
-------------------------------
 Credits - Vice-President,Technology Students' Gymkhana

This is to bring to the notice of people who are staying back here at the campus and those who will be coming back in the near future. Please keep yourself away from going to Gole Bazar and areas near to it for a few days as many cases of communal violence has been reported there immediately after the conclusion of Durga Pooja  which subsequently resulted in the curfew. A good number of serious casualties have also been reported. Stay connected for further updates!

Source: Campus Security

Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet || Water Polo Final

IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Kanpur with a good margin of 3 points (9-6). 

In the first quarter both the teams were equally competitive but then till the third quarter KGP dominated and score was 6-3. In the final quarter IIT Kanpur tried a comeback with 3 points but it was IIT Kharagpur who won the game 9-6.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for this Gold winning performance!

In the first quarter both the teams were equally competitive but then till the third quarter KGP dominated and score was 6-3. In the final quarter IIT Kanpur tried a comeback with 3 points but it was IIT Kharagpur who won the game 9-6.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for this Gold winning performance!

message:
IIT Kharagpur and Infosys Foundation,the philanthropic arm of Infosys have signed a MoU in which later has agreed to fund socially relevant projects undertaken by the institute. The major projects being funding of travel (preferably for women) to 'Top International Conferences' and the funding of the much-celebrated research of the Indus Valley antiquity which IIT Kgp is carrying out in association with the Archeological Survey of India. Sudha Murty,  Chairperson Infosys Foundation iterated the importance of funding the programmes that will help in the advancement of Education and Culture and said that the foundation was committed to nurturing such programmes.With support from Infosys Foundation, 8-10 meritorious girl students will be selected by a committee at IIT KGP to be sent to top conferences.
Prof. Anindya Shankar, the lead investigator of the project "Tracking the Antiquity and Climate during Bronze Age Harappan /Indus Valley Civilization (IVC) in India Using Isotope & Latest Chronological Techniques (CVO)" feels  that funds have reached at right time to maintain the pace of the research.

GC 2016-17 ll Athletics 
Final Standings (MEN)
1. MS Hall - 84 points
2. LBS Hall - 29 points
3. Nehru Hall - 24 points
4. RP Hall - 23 points
After 2 days of rigorous effort of the participants as well as the organising members, we have finally concluded the GC Athletics 2016-17. Like the previous year, MS played according to its reputation and swept through the Athletics round. It was followed by LBS which made a grand entry into the top 3. Nehru finished 3rd improving its position from the last year.

Final Standings (WOMEN)
1. SN Hall - 48 points
2. MT Hall - 13 points
3. SAM Hall - 10 points
The Female Athletics was undoubtedly dominated by SN Hall that scored more than all other teams combined. It was followed by MT and SAM Hall.

Visit the link given below and click on allow notifications to get the latest updates on GC: http://awaaziitkgp.org/GC201617.php
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners.
#GC_2016_17
#Athletics_Meet

IIT Kharagpur is going to host the quarter-finals of the prestigious Hult Prize 2017. IIT Kharagpur has been chosen as the venue along with IIT Delhi, BITS Pilani, IIM Ahmedabad and IIM Indore, where separate quarter finals will be held. 
This is to note that till 2013 only top tech and business schools of Europe and US could be venues for quarter finals. After ISB Hyderabad winning the 2014 competition made the organizers to re-think about allowing the quarterfinals to be held at Indian venues. 
To know more about Hult Prize please go through the following document: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzVuwdGrHJWQbUZOUHpCeFFvNXc/view?usp=sharing

आई आई टी खड़गपुर बहुत जल्द 'Science of Happiness' का माइक्रो क्रेडिट कोर्स शुरू करने वाला है। पहले चरण के तहत संस्थान ने दो दिन की अंतरराष्ट्रीय कार्यशाला का आयोजन किया है। इस कार्यशाला में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने भाग लेते हुए अपने अध्ययन को पोस्टर के माध्यम से प्रदर्शित किया। हमसे बात करते हुए आई आई टी खड़गपुर के Ph. D. Research Scholar,लक्ष्मी कान्त तिवारी ने बताया "आज-कल लोग अपनी भाग दौड़ भरी जिंदगी में इतने व्यस्त हैं कि उनको अपना खुद का ख्याल रखने का समय भी नहीं मिल पाता है। इसी कारण से पाया गया है कि उनको कई प्रकार की बीमारियां  हो जाती हैं और जब तक उनको बीमारी का पता चलता है तब तक काफी देर हो चुकी होती है। इसी कड़ी में नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारियां भी हैं। विश्व स्तर पर रिसर्च करने से पता चलता है कि करीब ३४ प्रतिशत लोग नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त है। विश्व स्वास्थ्य संगठन के हिसाब से १७.४ प्रतिशत मौत सिर्फ श्वास की बीमारी के कारण होती है और ४० प्रतिशत भारत के लोग २०२० तक ह्रदय से सम्बंधित बीमारियों से ग्रस्त हो जायेंगे। अगर इस प्रकार की गंभीर बीमारियों के बारे में समय रहते पता चल जाता है तो अकारण मौत के मुँह में जाने से लोगो को बचाया जा सकता है।"

क्या वास्तव में विज्ञान से लोग खुश हो सकते हैं ? इसके जवाब में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने बताया कि उनका सबसे पहला प्रयास तकनीक और खुशी को आपस में जोड़ना है। खुशहाल लोग जीवन को बड़ी आसानी से जीते हैं और बीमारियों के प्रभाव से दूर रहते हैं। 

तिवारी जी ने बताया कि हम सभी लोग अपने जीवन का एक तिहाई भाग सिर्फ सोने में बिताते हैं  और जिन लोगों को रात में अच्छे से नींद नहीं आती है वो लोग पूरे दिन थकावट महसूस करते हैं और कई बार अपनी काम करने की जगह पर ही सो जाते हैं। ऐसे लोग चिड़चिड़े भी होते हैं और समाज में उनका व्यवहार भी सही नहीं होता है। असल में इस प्रकार के लोग किसी न किसी प्रकार की सोने से सम्बंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त रहते है और चौंकाने वाली बात यह है कि उनमें से बहुत सारे लोगों को यह पता भी नहीं होता है। 

प्रोफ़ेसर अरविंद के पर्यवेक्षण में काम कर रहे कुछ छात्रों ने तीन प्रकार की स्लीप मॉनिटरिंग डिवाइसेस को ईजाद किया है। उनकी पहली डिवाइस बेडशीट की तरह है जिसको उपयोगकर्ता को अपने बेडशीट के निचे सोने से पहले बिछाना होगा। इस डिवाइस में एक विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर लगा है जो उपयोगकर्ता के ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापता है।अगर उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी कोई भी बीमारी है तो यह विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर उसे पकड़ लेता है और बीमारी से जुड़ी जानकारी उपयोगकर्ता के मोबाइल पर भेज देता है। इसके अलावा इसमें और भी तमाम प्रकार के सेंसर्स लगे हैं जो आपके बेडरूम की हवा की गुणवत्ता, तापमान और आद्रता के स्तर को भी नापता है। 
दूसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस भी उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी बीमारी से अवगत कराता है परंतु ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापने का तरीका पूरी तरह से अलग है। इस दूसरे प्रकार की डिवाइस को उपयोगकर्ता के बेडरूम में कहीं एक जगह दीवार पर लगा सकते हैं। यह डिवाइस पूरी तरह से वायरलेस टेक्नोलॉजी पर आधारित है। 
तीसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस थर्मल इमेजिंग के सिद्धांत पर काम करती है, यह डिवाइस उपयोगकर्ता के शरीर के तापमान को नापती है और उसी के आधार पर उपयोगकर्ता के स्टेट ऑफ़ स्लीप का आंकलन कर लेती है। 
बाजार में आने के बाद इन डिवाइसेस की कीमत ७००० से ८००० के आस पास होगी और अगले ६ या ७ महीने में डिवाइसेस बाजार में आ जाएंगे।

क्या वास्तव में विज्ञान से लोग खुश हो सकते है? इसके जवाब में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने बताया कि उनका सबसे पहला प्रयास तकनीक और खुशी को आपस में जोड़ना है। खुशहाल लोग जीवन को बड़ी आसानी से जीते हैं और बीमारियों के प्रभाव से दूर रहते हैं। 

तिवारी जी ने बताया कि हम सभी लोग अपने जीवन का एक तिहाई भाग सिर्फ सोने में बिताते है और जिन लोगों को रात में अच्छे से नींद नहीं आती है वो लोग पूरे दिन थकावट महसूस करते हैं और कई बार अपनी काम करने की जगह पर ही सो जाते हैं। ऐसे लोग चिड़चिड़े भी होते हैं और समाज में उनका व्यवहार भी सही नहीं होता है। असल में इस प्रकार के लोग किसी न किसी प्रकार की सोने से सम्बंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त रहते है और चौकाने वाली बात यह है कि उनमें से बहुत सारे लोगों को यह पता भी नहीं होता है। 

प्रोफ़ेसर अरविंद के पर्यवेक्षण में काम कर रहे कुछ छात्रों ने तीन प्रकार की स्लीप मॉनिटरिंग डिवाइसेस को ईजाद किया है। उनकी पहली डिवाइस बेडशीट की तरह है जिसको उपयोगकर्ता को अपने बेडशीट के निचे सोने से पहले बिछाना होगा। इस डिवाइस में एक विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर लगा है जो उपयोगकर्ता के ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापता है।अगर उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी कोई भी बीमारी है तो यह विशेष प्रकार का सेंसर उसे पकड़ लेता है और बीमारी से जुड़ी जानकारी उपयोगकर्ता के मोबाइल पर भेज देता है। इसके अलावा इसमें और भी तमाम प्रकार के सेंसर्स लगे हैं जो आपके बैडरूम की हवा की गुणवत्ता, तापमान और आद्रता के स्तर को भी नापता है। 
दूसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस भी उपयोगकर्ता को श्वास या ह्रदय से जुडी बीमारी से अवगत कराता है परंतु ह्रदय की धड़कन और सांस की गति को नापने का तरीका पूरी तरह से अलग है। इस दूसरे प्रकार की डिवाइस को उपयोगकर्ता के बैडरूम में कहीं एक जगह दीवार पर लगा सकते हैं। यह डिवाइस पूरी तरह से वायरलेस टेक्नोलॉजी पर आधारित है। 
तीसरी प्रकार की डिवाइस थर्मल इमेजिंग के सिद्धांत पर काम करती है, यह डिवाइस उपयोगकर्ता के शरीर के तापमान को नापती है और उसी के आधार पर उपयोगकर्ता के स्टेट ऑफ़ स्लीप का आंकलन कर लेती है। 
बाजार में आने के बाद इन डिवाइसेस की कीमत ७००० से ८००० के आस पास होगी और अगले ६ या ७ महीने में डिवाइसेस बाजार में आ जाएंगे।

आई आई टी खड़गपुर बहुत जल्द 'Science of Happiness' का माइक्रो क्रेडिट कोर्स शुरू करने वाला है। पहले चरण के तहत संस्थान ने दो दिन की अंतरराष्ट्रीय कार्यशाला का आयोजन किया है। इस कार्यशाला में आई आई टी खड़गपुर के छात्रों ने भाग लेते हुए अपने अध्ययन को पोस्टर के माध्यम से प्रदर्शित किया। हमसे बात करते हुए आई आई टी खड़गपुर के Ph. D. Research Scholar,लक्ष्मी कान्त तिवारी ने बताया "आज-कल लोग अपनी भाग दौड़ भरी जिंदगी में इतने व्यस्त हैं कि उनको अपना खुद का ख्याल रखने का समय भी नहीं मिल पाता है। इसी कारण से पाया गया है कि उनको कई प्रकार की बीमारियाँ हो जाती हैं और जब तक उनको बीमारी का पता चलता है तब तक काफी देर हो चुकी होती है। इसी कड़ी में नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारियाँ भी हैं। विश्व स्तर पर रिसर्च करने से पता चलता है कि करीब ३४ प्रतिशत लोग नींद न आने से संबंधित बीमारी से ग्रस्त है। विश्व स्वास्थ्य संगठन के हिसाब से १७.४ प्रतिशत मौत सिर्फ श्वास की बीमारी के कारण होती है और ४० प्रतिशत भारत के लोग २०२० तक ह्रदय से सम्बंधित बीमारियों से ग्रस्त हो जायेंगे। अगर इस प्रकार की गंभीर बीमारियों के बारे में समय रहते पता चल जाता है तो अकारण मौत के मुँह में जाने से लोगो को बचाया जा सकता है।"

Professor Rajendra Singh (Ex Dean-UGS, Ex HOD- Department of Agricultural & Food Engineering), has been selected as Chair Professor for Water Resources (Brahmaputra & Tributaries) by the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development & Ganga Rejuvenation, Government of India.

Our congratulations to Professor Singh and we wish him a successful tenure!

All the students are advised not to visit the Gole Bazaar area in the next 3-4 days in view of the prevailing tension in the aftermath of the alleged death of an 18 year youth, who was beaten by the locals after a nominal bike collision last night, finally succumbing to injuries. 
The situation is still grim with several shops set on fire and the mob attacking the police while the latter lobbed tear gas shells to control the case. We are having a close eye on the development and if the situation doesn't improve, section 144 (Prohibition on unlawful assembly) of the Indian Penal Code shall be imposed tomorrow, said Shri JP Meena, District Magistrate, Paschim Medinipur.

Source: Anandabazar Patrika (A Bengali Daily)

A group of 15 students from the Department of Biotechnology has earned the rare distinction of being invited to showcase their unique genetic engineering skills at the world’s biggest competition in the field — the International Genetically Engineered Machine (IGEM) — at Boston, the United States to be held between October 27 and 31. The event is hosted at Hynes convention centre, Boston. They will demonstrate a technique devised to extract spider silk in an economical and quicker way. This will be the second time that IIT-KGP will be participating in this competition since its inception in 2004.
The spider silk, due to its high tensile strength and elasticity, has potential applications as a bio-material and since it is bio-compatible and biodegradable, it has great use in medical and pharmaceutical industries.
Courtesy: Hindustan Times

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates them and wishes them All the Best for the event.

After a number of activities around Hall swap, first being allowed then abolished, finally, the hall swap has been officially announced with few procedural conditions. However, this practice has been called off from next year onwards.
One can have a look on the official notice regarding the mutual hall swap of 2nd year UG students.

The dates of Spring Fest and Kshitij have been rescheduled. The new dates are:
Spring Fest 2017 - 20th - 22nd January 2017
Kshitij 2017 - 27th - 29th January 2017

Although the dates have changed it is important here to notice the reduction in the number of days. Now the fest will be of two and half days only instead of the regular 3.5 days.

News Credits : VP TSG

किसी भी देश के उत्थान में उस देश की भाषा की अत्यन्त महत्त्वपूर्ण भूमिका होती है। भारतीय संविधान ने 14 सितम्बर 1949 को हिंदी को भारत की राजभाषा घोषित किया था। 14 सितम्बर को हिंदी दिवस के अवसर पर राजभाषा विभाग, आईआईटी खड़गपुर हिंदी भाषा के प्रचार प्रसार के लिए विभिन्न कार्यक्रमों का आयोजन कर रहा है जिसमें सभी छात्र सादर आमंत्रित हैं। 
दिनाँक - 14 सितम्बर 
समय   - 11 am - अतिथि व्याख्यान - श्री राहुल देव 
              5 pm  - संवाद - श्री राहुल देव 
स्थान  -  प्रो. एस एन बोस प्रेक्षागृह
